title: Supercuts goes into administration putting 1,200 jobs and 220 salons at risk
text:
Hairdressing chains Supercuts and Regis have become the latest victims of the high street slump after their owner collapsed into administration on Thursday night putting about 1,200 jobs at risk.

The brands’ 220 salons will remain open while administrators at Deloitte explore options, including finding a buyer for Regis UK Limited, which owns the brands, and its holding company International Beauty Limited.

No redundancies or store closures are being announced at this stage.

“Like many retail related businesses, Regis UK Limited has suffered from changes in consumer behaviour and subsequent reduction in footfall, particularly in shopping centres where a number of salons are located,” Deloitte...
description: Hairdressing chains Supercuts and Regis have become the latest victims of the high street slump after their owner collapsed into administration on Thursday night putting about 1,200 jobs at risk.
